entries.definition: the method of human communication, either spoken or written, consisting of the use of words in a structured and conventional way
examples: The English language is spoken worldwide

entries.definition: acquire knowledge or skill in (something) by study, experience, or being taught
examples: I learned to drive when I was seventeen

entries.definition: the whole system and structure of a language or of languages in general, usually taken as consisting of syntax and morphology
examples: English grammar can be quite complex
She teaches grammar to elementary students

entries.definition: the body of words used in a particular language
examples: Medical vocabulary can be difficult to understand

entries.definition: perceive the intended meaning of (words, a language, or a speaker)
